sys_metadata_link.payload:
true
  • AWS credentials: Required to connect ServiceNow with your AWS environment
    • Account number
    • Access key
    • Secret key
    • ServiceNow requires a MID server to access AWS environment. The MID server can reside in your on-premesis environment or in AWS itself. Please follow instruction on MID server setup here
  • Datacenter URL (Required only for AWS GovCloud (US) accounts: Full URL of the datacenter, for example: https://<IP-of-center>/sdk.)
  • The AWS user used to connect ServiceNow to AWS must have the following permissions setup in their IAM profile.  Please follow Cloud Provisioning and Governance Documentation for more details.  
  • Parent account: Appears when you select AWS datacenter
    • Select the AWS main account that represents the Organization in AWS that this member account belongs to.
    • Leave the field empty if this account is not part of an AWS Organization
  • Is main account: Appears when you select AWS datacenter
    • Clear the check box if the account is not the Organization account.
    • Select the check box to associate the AWS cloud service account with the main account. The main account corresponds to the Organization in AWS. You can identify any cloud service account in your instance as a main account only if you already configured the account in AWS as an Organization and you already associated other accounts under the Organization. See the AWS documentation for information on Organizations.

    • For more information, see the AWS setup guide.                         

    ]]>
